Transcript: school is out Wednesday. Could leave Wed 10:15 arriving Texarkana about 8:15. Thanksgiving to Austin? Fri & Sat--?? Lv. Austin Sun arriving Washington Sunday night or Mon a.m. With you – I’ve forgotten it tho’--Don’t worry.   may have mailed this American Airlines schedule to Lady Bird as early as
Title: Note, Lyndon Johnson to Lady Bird Taylor, September 23, 1934?
Creator: Lyndon Baines Johnson
Abstract: LBJ writes his tentative itinerary on an American Airlines schedule. He may have enclosed the schedule with his letter written on September 23 or a later letter. The schedule appears to have been tri-folded and mailed with a letter sent in a legal-size envelope.
Rights: The LBJ Presidential Library has no information about the original source of this item. Copyright restrictions may apply.
Collection: The Personal Papers of Lyndon and Lady Bird Johnson are a collection of correspondence between Lyndon and Lady Bird Johnson that spans 1934 through 1968. During the Johnsons’ years in the White House, Dorothy Territo, a staff assistant who maintained files of high historical value, as well as family and genealogical material, had custody of the collection. In 1969, the files she kept came to Austin as part of President Johnson’s papers, which he had deeded to the U.S. government in August 1965.This collection includes the courtship letters between Lyndon Johnson and Claudia "Lady Bird" Taylor, from the period between their introduction and their marriage, September – November 1934.
Citation: “Note, Lyndon Johnson to Lady Bird Taylor, September 23, 1934?,” Personal Papers of Lyndon B. and Lady Bird Johnson, LBJ Presidential Library, Dear Bird: The 1934 Courtship Letters, accessed November 27, 2016, http://archives.lbjlibrary.org/items/show/389.
